title: Bio Kim victim of golf's double standards as stars like Sergio Garcia rake in the money despite continued temper tantrums
text:
If you want to gauge how brazen professional golf’s double standards happen to be then consider that Bio Kim is banned from playing in Korea’s biggest event this month because of his on-course behaviour in 2019 - and Sergio Garcia is not.

One dared to raise his middle finger in a moment of anger, while the other damaged greens, in 90 minutes of fury in Saudi Arabia earlier this year, and, who just a few months later, threw a driver at his caddie.

One previously boasted a clean record, while the other had been reprimanded for multiple tantrums, as well as an occasion of racism. One was suspended for three years and sees his entire career in jeopardy, while the other has never been suspended for as much as a day and has watched the millions roll in regardless.

One will miss the CJ Cup in two weeks’ time, while the other will be there to carry on filling his wheelbarrow with greenback. This is modern golf for you, where the punishment does not so much fit the crime, as much as it fits the profile and earning potential.
